titleStmt.title: A transcription of John in GA 274

licence.p: Copyright © 2020 by Joey McCollum under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0)

msContents.summary: Four Gospels with notes, adpated for liturgical use

objectDesc.p: Parchment, 231 by 172 mm, 30 quires, 232 folios, 1 column, 24 to 26 lines per column, written in Greek.
The main text is written in bouletée minuscule, while most lectionary and other marginal notes are written in a semi-majuscule form.
5 paper folios written in the seventeenth century are included as supplements for missing portions.

ab.note: A drop-cap α was probably intended, but not written.
A drop-cap κ was probably intended, but not written.
A later hand supplied the rest of the word under the line. A separate hand later supplied the supplemental pages that follow.
A drop-cap τ was probably intended but not written.
A drop-cap κ was probably intended, but not written.
It appears that a minuscule omicron was originally written after a normal line break, but was subsequently erased when a drop-cap omicron was written in ekthesis.
A drop-cap ν was probably intended, but not written.
A drop-cap π was probably intended, but not written.

A drop-cap θ was probably intended, but not written.
A drop-cap υ was probably intended, but not written.
A drop-cap ε was probably intended, but not written.
The word ασθενων is omitted after this point in the text, but the lectionary incipit includes it.

The word τον in written by a later hand under this line, but this appears to be to indicate where the supplement picks up the text.
A drop-cap π was probably intended, but not written.
As this is marked as the start of a new paragraph, there's a chance that a drop-cap ο (as an article before this word) was intended, but not written.
